basics.name: Stephen L Boettcher
basics.label: Front-End Focused Full-Stack Developer
res_summary: Versatile and highly accomplished Web Developer with over 10 years of experience delivering scalable, high-performance applications across the stack. Adept at building modern, maintainable interfaces using frameworks like Svelte, React, and Vue, with a strong focus on accessibility, performance, and clean architecture. Experienced in backend integration, API design, and component-based development that supports large, multi-site ecosystems.

Recognized for leading front-end initiatives and fostering collaboration between design, engineering, and product teams. Successfully directed the redesign of the PCH Weekly Prize site, improving UX and achieving a 20% increase in organic traffic. Known for technical leadership, thoughtful UX implementation, and the ability to translate business goals into efficient, future-proof code solutions that drive measurable impact.
home_summary: Welcome! This portfolio is a work in progress, evolving as I refine and expand my work. Built with Svelte, SASS, and a touch of Tailwind CSS, it's hosted on Netlify. I've also added a Blog section, where I share insights and experiences using markdown-based posts.

I'm a seasoned web technology leader with a deep foundation in front-end development, specializing in crafting dynamic, accessible, and user-friendly web experiences using HTML, CSS, and modern JavaScript frameworks like Svelte, React, and Vue. My expertise also spans into back-end technologies such as PHP, Node.js, and Next.js, enabling me to build seamless full-stack solutions.

Beyond the code, I bring a robust background in technical leadership, project management, and business analysis. I've honed skills in orchestrating cross-functional teams, serving as a Scrum Master to streamline agile delivery, and effectively bridging the gap between complex business needs and impactful technical solutions. My journey in technology started with C programming, developing backup software for Windows, which sharpened my problem-solving skills and attention to detail, qualities that continue to shape my holistic approach to development and project oversight today.

I thrive on challenges, continuously learning and adapting to the ever-evolving landscape of technology. If you're looking for a professional passionate about performance, usability, and innovation, who can also lead teams and drive projects from concept to completion, let’s connect!

work.name: Freelance / Independent Projects
highlights: Designed and built modern, performant websites for multiple clients, including a poet, a handyman business, and personal portfolio projects, using frameworks such as Svelte, React, Next.js, and Astro, with a focus on responsive layouts, accessibility, SEO, and clean, component-driven architecture.
Leveraged GitHub Actions and Netlify CI/CD pipelines to automate builds and streamline deployments across multiple environments.
Implemented accessibility best practices to ensure inclusive, user-friendly experiences across devices.

work.name: Publishers Clearing House
highlights: Delivered scalable, modular front-end architectures by translating complex UI/UX requirements into performant, reusable components while guiding engineers on quality and performance best practices.

Led major initiatives at PCH, including redesigning the Weekly Prize website (resulting in 20% organic traffic growth) and building shared components like the portable navigation system used across 15+ properties.
Created high-impact UI features, such as a reusable tooltip component with 1,500+ positive feedback responses, and drove accessibility improvements across 30+ pages to meet WCAG standards.
Mentored junior and mid-level developers through regular 1:1s and promoted modern front-end patterns to strengthen team collaboration and long-term maintainability.

work.name: Publishers Clearing House
highlights: Built and maintained a scalable Storybook component library, delivering modular UI patterns that cut project development time by over 15 hours through standardization and code reuse.
Engineered key engagement features, including a targeted communication module and new game mechanics, that increased customer interaction metrics by more than 20%.

Improved site reliability and performance by reducing load times by 25% through code and asset optimization, and by introducing robust unit and E2E testing that reduced bug-related downtime by ~35 hours monthly.
Integrated advanced third-party APIs to enable real-time content rendering and more dynamic user experiences.

work.name: Publishers Clearing House
highlights: Bridged business and engineering by converting requirements into actionable user stories and clear functional specs, improving alignment across teams.
Led Agile Scrum processes and optimized delivery by removing blockers, improving communication, and maintaining transparent timelines.
Coordinated integrations with legacy and third-party systems, ensuring architectural continuity and reducing operational risk.
Strengthened stakeholder collaboration by explaining technical constraints and guiding requirement discussions toward realistic, high-impact solutions.

work.name: Computer Associates (CA Technologies)
work.position: Director / Senior Manager - ARCserve Software Engineering
highlights: Led global engineering teams across multiple time zones, driving architectural strategy, feature delivery, and performance improvements for ARCserve’s enterprise backup products.
Directed technical planning and long-term product vision, ensuring alignment between engineering efforts and business objectives.
Oversaw design and development of large-scale, high-reliability systems, promoting strong architecture, code quality, and maintainability.
Engineered high-performance Win32 C components early in tenure, resolving critical crash sources and significantly improving product stability.
Implemented formal peer-review practices and cross-team knowledge sharing that elevated code quality and accelerated development efficiency.
Provided technical training for engineering, support, and sales teams, strengthening cross-functional understanding of product capabilities and constraints.

projects.name: Blog for a Poet
projects.description: Worked with a poet to create a blog that would allow her to post her poetry and share it with the world.  The site was built using Next.js and Astro, allowing for a fast and responsive experience.  The site is hosted on Netlify and uses markdown files for the blog posts.
highlights: Static site generator using Astro to create a fast and responsive blog.
Used markdown files for the blog posts, allowing for easy editing and management of content.
The site is hosted on Netlify, allowing for easy deployment and management of the site.

projects.name: Custom Bingo Card Generator
projects.description: This project was developed through an interactive collaboration with Gemini AI. By iteratively prompting and refining ideas, I was able to define the core concept, refine the technical description, and identify key features, ultimately bringing the Custom Bingo Card Generator to life.
highlights: AI-Powered Customization: Leverages the Gemini AI API to intelligently generate unique bingo card lists based on user-provided topics.
Canned topics also available, built using Gemini AI to generate a list of topics that can be used to create bingo cards and stored ina JSON file.
Dynamic Content Generation: Offers both a selection of pre-defined static topics from a JSON file and dynamic, on-demand content creation.
Modern & Responsive Stack: Built with Next.js and React, ensuring a fast, responsive, and seamless user experience across devices.
Intuitive User Experience: Designed for effortless creation of personalized bingo games for various purposes.

projects.name: PCH Surveys
projects.description: PCH was developing a site to collect user information through surveys. I wasn’t involved from the start, but I was brought in to help get the project back on track. The frontend was being handled by two junior developers who were receiving tasks from the backend team but struggling to meet deadlines. After assessing the challenges, I worked closely with them to improve their workflow. We implemented daily touch-point meetings to address roadblocks in real-time and introduced structured code reviews to ensure their work was QA-ready. These changes helped streamline development, and we successfully delivered the site on time with high quality.
highlights: Through pair programming and design discussions we were able to workout a plan on ho to deliver the outstanding features that were needed to get the site out the door.
Using Storybook I was able to setup their components so they could mock the data sent to the components and see how they would look without a dependency on the backend team.

projects.name: Replace PCH's Info site...
projects.description: The Publishers Clearing House 'Info' site was previously hosted on WordPress, but the costs outweighed its needs and update frequency. I was part of a team tasked with replacing it with a more cost-effective, maintainable static site. We built the new site using Nuxt.js, leveraging Vue.js to generate static HTML and CSS. Tailwind CSS was used for styling, ensuring a responsive design. The project was integrated into a CI/CD pipeline, automating builds and deployments to a staging environment for review before going live.
highlights: Developed a static site using Nuxt.js, Vue.js, and Tailwind CSS.
Created a command line utility to create the boilerplate template for a Vue.js page.

Used GitLab Issues to manage the project, we created an issue for each of the pages we needed to convert from the old site and used GitLab to help generate the branches and track through the Issues tab.
The site is live here: https://info.pch.com.

projects.name: Excel spreadsheet to JSON converter
projects.description: We had an internal site that let users enter a code that would be tied to an offer and it was an older system that they would receive a spreadsheet by email and then manually copy the new codes into the javascript file for this site.  So it was labor intensive and had to be done by a developer to not cause any issue if the user accidentally broke the javascript.  I create a command line utility they could usee to specify the  incoming excel file and this tool would parse the excel file and output a JSON file that could be used in the site.  This saved them a lot of time and effort and they were able to do it themselves.
highlights: Found an NPM package that would help me load the excel file in a format that I could traverse like an object and from that pull out the data I needed and write to the JSON file
The command line was simple to use and would look something like this: 'node build/excelConverter.js -e 'codes/in/Spreadsheet.xlsx' -o 'codes/out/codes_out.json'

projects.name: Fake-le Game
projects.description: This was a learning project I took an after seeing a video on a simulated React interview where they asked the interviewee to create a version of the popular game Wordle, built as a React app. I created a React/Typescript project and built the game you can try here.
highlights: Used an API that I found to get the words at https://random-word-api.herokuapp.com/word
Implemented features from the game as I went, still some items I'm looking to add.

projects.name: Stepped Registration
projects.description: Developed an innovative registration system that transformed the traditional form-filling experience into a conversational journey. This Single Page Application utilized a component-based architecture to guide users through a natural, step-by-step account creation process. The system transformed standard data collection into an engaging, dialogue-like interaction that enhanced user experience while gathering necessary registration information.
highlights: Innovated a versatile component library initially focused on user registration that evolved into a comprehensive system for creating diverse stepped user experiences across multiple applications
Engineered a robust backend integration system that dynamically generates page layouts and component configurations through structured JSON data, enabling flexible content management
Transformed static JSON configurations into a dynamic system supporting personalized user experiences based on user segments, significantly improving engagement and conversion rates
Developed fully tested, reusable components with comprehensive unit tests using Mocha and Chai, ensuring reliability and maintainability across the system
We setup a wiki that we could link to the Admin for reference as need and made this part of every new component we built.  This helped expand my markdown writing skills.

projects.name: Universal Navigation (8 sites)
projects.description: Led the re-design of PCH's Universal Navigation bar that is used on 8 of the websites in the PCH umbrella. The navigation bar has multiple interactive areas so there was significant HTML markup, CSS styling and event driven Javascript.  We were given designs in Figma and we had multiple meetings to walkthrough how users will integrate and how web admins might configure, leading to us creating and sizing stories for the dev work needed to build it.
highlights: We built a test site where we could stand up the Uninav on it's own to develop it and work on the different configurations to see how they rendered and functioned
Once it was functional and deployable we integrated it with one site at a time, addressing any conflicts or issues that we observed running it on that site

projects.name: PCH Weekly Grand Prize Website

images.alt: PCH Weekly Grand Prize page (orig figma)

projects.description: Led the development of PCH's Weekly Grand Prize website, a strategic initiative to expand prize engagement to both registered and non-registered users. Implemented a dynamic prize showcase system that integrates with our internal Prize Tracking System to display current weekly offerings. Engineered a seamless user flow that intelligently handles both registered and anonymous users, directing new users through a streamlined registration process before returning them to claim their prize entry. Leveraged our existing component library to ensure consistency while optimizing for the unique requirements of prize promotion and user acquisition. The site successfully increased user engagement and registration rates while maintaining high performance and accessibility standards.
highlights: Engineered a responsive, mobile-first design using Laravel components, vanilla JavaScript, and CSS, ensuring optimal user experience across all devices and screen sizes
Implemented comprehensive SEO optimizations including semantic HTML structure, meta tags, and structured data markup to improve search engine visibility
Achieved WCAG 2.1 AA compliance through careful attention to accessibility features including ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, screen reader compatibility, and sufficient color contrast ratios
Developed custom JavaScript modules for prize entry validation and user flow management without relying on heavy frameworks, resulting in faster page load times
Introduced a modular CSS architecture using BEM methodology and CSS custom properties to maintain consistent styling while enabling easy theme customization

projects.name: Realtime Ad Module System

images.alt: Lightbox with iframe adjusts to height

projects.description: Developed a sophisticated real-time ad delivery system that seamlessly integrates both third-party and internal advertisements without requiring page reloads. The system interfaces with Kevel (our internal ad server) to dynamically serve targeted content ranging from simple markup and images to complex interactive ads from providers like Rokt and AdsPostx. Built a robust architecture that efficiently queries the ad server and renders appropriate content within secure iframes, ensuring optimal performance and user experience while maintaining site stability.
highlights: Engineered a responsive iframe service that dynamically monitors ad content dimensions and communicates with the parent page to seamlessly adjust layouts, preventing content jumps and ensuring smooth user experience
Developed a comprehensive JavaScript tracking library that captures and reports critical ad metrics including view-ability, engagement time, and click-through rates to optimize ad performance and ROI
Implemented an intelligent caching system that pre-loads upcoming ads to minimize latency and provide instant content transitions between ad displays

projects.name: GA Event Tracking Service
projects.description: Developed a robust Google Analytics Event Tracking Service that simplifies click event monitoring across web applications. The service utilizes a data attribute-based system to automatically detect and track user interactions, transforming specified HTML elements into trackable components. It seamlessly captures and transmits event data to Google Analytics, requiring minimal setup while providing comprehensive tracking capabilities. Built with modern tooling including Vite and Vitest, the service is thoroughly tested and optimized for easy integration into any JavaScript project.
highlights: Implemented an intelligent redirect delay system that ensures accurate event tracking by waiting for analytics data transmission before page navigation
Engineered a sophisticated first-click tracking mechanism to prevent duplicate event submissions and maintain data accuracy
Established an automated CI/CD pipeline for seamless package versioning and distribution through NPM, ensuring reliable and consistent updates

projects.name: Email Validation Tool
projects.description: Developed an internal tool for the email team to validate email HTML by running it through a series of automated tests. The tool utilized regex patterns to identify positive or negative matches, ensuring email content adhered to required standards. This solution significantly increased the email team's productivity and reduced the risk of sending out broken or non-compliant emails.
highlights: Allowed users to paste in or upload HTML and run it through the tests.
Added the ability for the Email team to add their own tests to the tool as needed.

projects.name: Teachers App
projects.description: Developed a comprehensive teacher's application for assisting in doing student evaluations.  The application allows teachers to create and manage student profiles and evaluations.  It also the teacher to create a bank of student evaluation comments that can be used and personalized for each evaluation.
highlights: Created a student registration portion of the app to add students to the system.
Created a student evaluation portion of the app to allow teachers to create evaluations for students.
Created a bank of student evaluation comments that can be used and personalized for each evaluation.
Added support for drag and drop of banked comments into a student evaluation
